A B C G I M O R S T X

S

setAudioBuffer(ByteBuffer) - Method in class com.backyardbrains.drawing.OscilliscopeGLThread
Called by the instantiating activity, this sets to ByteBuffer to be sent down to the BybGLDrawable on the new call to BybGLDrawable.draw(GL10)
setCurrentAudio(ByteBuffer) - Method in class com.backyardbrains.BackyardAndroidActivity
Called by AudioService.receiveAudio(ByteBuffer) to push current sample buffer into our OscilliscopeGLThread for drawing
setRunningActivity(BackyardAndroidActivity) - Method in class com.backyardbrains.BackyardBrainsApplication
Used by BackyardAndroidActivity to tell the application it's in the foreground so that AudioService.receiveAudio(java.nio.ByteBuffer) can retrieve it via BackyardBrainsApplication.getRunningActivity()
setServiceRunning(boolean) - Method in class com.backyardbrains.BackyardBrainsApplication
have the service set whether or not it's polling mic data
start(RecievesAudio) - Method in class com.backyardbrains.audio.MicListener
An alternate to Thread.start(), which allows us to provide a service which implements RecievesAudio then start the thread as normal.
startAudioService() - Method in class com.backyardbrains.BackyardBrainsApplication
If AudioService has not told us it's running, tell it to start
stopAudioService() - Method in class com.backyardbrains.BackyardBrainsApplication
signal AudioService to stop
surfaceChanged(SurfaceHolder, int, int, int) - Method in class com.backyardbrains.drawing.OscilliscopeGLSurfaceView
 
surfaceCreated(SurfaceHolder) - Method in class com.backyardbrains.drawing.OscilliscopeGLSurfaceView
When we're created, immediately spin up a new OscilloscopeGLThread
surfaceDestroyed(SurfaceHolder) - Method in class com.backyardbrains.drawing.OscilliscopeGLSurfaceView
Require cleanup of GL resources before exiting.
